text_data.1744987729.490--9223372036854775799:
[]>narrator: Thank you for downloading DIISIS. You seem to have set it up so it doesn't explode your project. <mp>Good job!
[]>narrator: In this demo, you will find the fundamentals of DIISIS' functionalities included in the script "demo_script.json" so you can get accustomed to how things work. <mp>To open said script, just press on the [img]res://addons/diisis/logos/icon_buttonbw smooth.png[/img] button in the top right corner inside Godot!
[]>amber{amber-emotion|neutral}: Hi! I'm Amber, one of the robotgirls created to anthropomorphize DIISIS.
[]>narrator: Imagine her, gently watching over you as you work. Like a little guardian robotangel, just for you.
[]>amber: That I am!
[]>narrator: What you will see next is a basic demo of choices in DIISIS. You can give any number of options to the player. <mp>For each option, you can attach so-called "Facts" to the option.
[]>narrator: Facts can either be boolean (true or false) or integers (whole numbers). Then you can check against them having some value at a later point. <mp>In this example, we have a fact called "liked amber". It is boolean and starts out as <fact:liked amber>. If you press the first button, it gets set to true.
[]>narrator: Isn't she cool?
text_data.1744987729.798--9223372036854775779:
[]>narrator: And then we only show the appropriate line.
[]>narrator{amber-emotion|neutral}: Choices can also jump to any point in the document upon being picked and have other behavior for more advanced use cases.
[]>narrator: You can find all of that in the [url=https://github.com/SnekOfSpice/dialog-editor/wiki/Line-Type:-Choice]wiki on GitHub[/url].
text_data.1747980436.065--9223372036854775806:
[]>stella: Isn't it fucked up that it was just us two today?
[]>pedro: What do you mean?
[]>stella: Like...
[]>stella: She always seemed like...
[]>stella: She had more people around her.
[]>pedro: I think it did.
[]>pedro: Just not irl.
[]>stella: It did.
[]>stella: I know that.
[]>stella: We both saw the ream of Discord handles.
[]>pedro: ...
[]>stella: ...
[]>stella: But irls.
[]>stella: It had a social network for fuck's sake!
[]>stella: You couldn't go to any fucking event in this city without her running into someone she knew.
[]>stella: ...
[]>pedro: ...
[]>pedro: Who knows.
[]>stella: I wish I did.
[]>pedro: Same.
[]>pedro: ...
[]>pedro: Wanna grab food?
[]>stella: I don't care.
[]>pedro: It'll soothe the nerves.
[]>stella: Fine.
text_data.1747980568.680--9223372036854775792:
[]>lucy: Hi Stella,\n
Sorry to do this to you.\n<mp>
A very stupid part of my brain is telling me to feel sorry for you. Because you fought so hard and so often to keep me alive, only to end up with my corpse in your arms anyways. But I'll try to ignore it as I write this letter.\n<mp>
I'm thankful for the time we had together. You've truly been one of the best friends I ever had the honor of calling my contemporary. You are a profoundly insightful individual, and deserve all the happiness this life has to offer.\n<mp>
If you want to know the why... you already know it, kinda. <mp>It's not like life isn't worth experiencing. But I am through with it. <mp>There is only so much mental strain I can take before I get crushed underneath... everything. I can barely remember the good times. But somehow my regrets and existential pain remain. And pile up. <mp>Every year becomes increasingly more exhausting than the last- On a fundamental level. <mp>I do not want to live a life where I spend a growing number of days doing nothing but fighting depression. I'm tired. I struggle to feel like I belong anywhere.\n<mp>
I love you.\n<mp>
I love you with all of my heart and soul and even though I am in the process of running a blade through your heart with these words, I assure you, that without you, my night sky would've been unimaginably dimmer.\n<mp>
Stella. I entrust you with large parts of my former life. If there is one girl in the world that can leave with this, I know it to be you.\n<mp>
Yours dearest,
Lucy
text_data.1747980855.812--9223372036854775763:
[]>pedro: Also can't really get anything down, huh?
[]>stella: [font_size=10][shake rate=20.0 level=2 connected=1]I... just want her back...[/shake][/font_size] 
[]>stella: [shake rate=20.0 level=4 connected=1]Fuck.[/shake]
[]>stella: Why did we have to go out to eat in public?
[]>pedro: Because we're kinda stupid.
[]>stella:...
[]>stella: Wanna get up?
[]>pedro: Sure.
[]>pedro: I'll pay, be there in a sec.
text_data.1747980880.789--9223372036854775761:
[]>stella: I hope you're in a better place now.
[]>stella: Today was rough.
[]>stella: Probate court was more intimidating than I thought.
[]>stella: Almost at the end of the pack today.
[]>stella: Sorry.
[]>stella: I know you'd prefer if I didn't.
[]>stella: I'll smoke less again, promise.
[]>stella: Just for today.
[]>stella: ...
[]>stella: ...
[]>stella: ...Sorry, Lucy.
[]>stella: ...
[]>stella: Thank you for the letter. I'll... read it soon.

text_data.1747981886.784--9223372036854775758:
[]>stella: Fuck...
[]>stella: Wanna go for a walk? There's the park down the street isn't there?
[]>rose: Sure!
[]>rose: Is it... bad news?
[]>stella: Yes.
[]>rose: Oh...
[]>stella: Let's go.
text_data.1747981891.758--9223372036854775756:
[]>stella: I had the will read out with Pedro last week on the 30th, and barely anyone was mentioned there.
[]>stella: So we've been slowly going through who we think it was close to and breaking the news.
[]>rose: ...
[]>stella: ...
[]>rose: I can...
[]>rose: This is horrible.
[]>stella:...
[]>rose:...
[]>stella:Are you...?
[]>rose:I'll be fine, just gimme a second.
[]>rose:...
[]>rose:...Unexpected.
[]>rose:...We...
[]>rose: ...We graduated not even 2 years ago.
[]>stella: I know.
[]>rose:...
[]>stella: Still remember the party afterwards?
[]>stella: She was so hammered.
[]>rose: ...
[]>rose: You carried us both back to my apartment.
[]>stella: Which you didn't even remember, by the way.
[]>rose: I had always been bad with directions.
[]>stella: Lucy couldn't even stand upright anymore and knew the way.
[]>rose: She was so real for that.
[]>stella: ...
[]>rose: Was as in...
[]>rose: On that evening.
[]>rose: ...
[]>stella: ...
[]>rose: Fuck this permanence.
[]>stella: ...
[]>stella: Fuck this permanence.
[]>rose: Ugh...
[]>rose: Okay, I know this is supposed to be the other way around, but how are you coping with it?
[]>rose: I feel like I'll be better if I can listen to your headspace.
[]>stella: ...
[]>stella: It's been difficult.
[]>stella: I cry so fucking much.
[]>stella: I miss her so much.
[]>rose: Mhm.
[]>rose: I expect I'll cry too, once the shock is gone.
[]>stella: Text me if you need it, by the way.
[]>rose: I will take you up on the offer.
[]>rose: And you're just talking to those you know about it?
[]>stella: Sigh... you're like the third person I have this talk with.
[]>stella: How horrifying that...
[]>stella: A routine talking about my dead friend?
[]>rose: Humans are good at pattern recognition.
[]>stella: Hm?
[]>rose: If it becomes slightly regular, your brain will hone in on it, is what I'm trying to say.
[]>rose: Don't feel bad about it.
[]>stella: I know.
[]>rose: ...
[]>stella: ...
[]>stella: We knew each other for like 5 years for fuck's sake!
[]>stella: I guess a fifth of your life is long enough to consider me worthy to put into your will.
[]>stella: Fuck.
[]>rose: I only really met her a few months before we graduated.
[]>stella: That's still around 2 years.
[]>stella: Makes you ancient in my books.
[]>stella: And in hers too.
[]>rose: Was she meeting that many new people all the time?
[]>stella: I think so.

text_data.1747981991.821--9223372036854775712:
[]>stella: Hi Lucy.
[]>stella: I'm not smoking today, see?
[]>stella: ...
[]>stella: Please see...
[]>stella: ...
[]>stella: Fuck.
[]>stella: I miss you so hard.
[]>stella: ...
[]>stella: Even though you'd...
[]>stella: You'd probably go "it's ok".
[]>stella: "Whatever it takes just to feel a li'l okay."
[]>stella: And I'd feel your radiance and know you wouldn't judge me.
[]>stella: And you'd do it.
[]>stella: Always.
[]>stella: ...
[]>stella: God, fuck.
[]>stella: ...
[]>stella: You can't even imagine the hole you left behind.
[]>stella: You cared so much.
[]>stella: It's so difficult.
[]>stella: And...
[]>stella: Fuck.
[]>stella: Not smoking today.
[]>stella: Yay me.
[]>stella: I'm giving you a big hug.
[]>stella: And I'm not getting ash on your letter.
[]>stella: ...
[]>stella: I miss you.
[]>stella: I miss you so much.
[]>stella: I miss you every single fucking day and it's not really getting any better.
[]>stella: Is this what you've felt like?
[]>stella: All the time?
[]>stella: Fuck- I'm so sorry.
[]>stella: Ugh! What am I saying?
[]>stella: I hope it was the right decision.
[]>stella: ...
[]>stella: Letter time.
text_data.1747991281.840--9223372036854775473:
[]>stella: ...
[]>stella: Lucy died.
[]>rose: What?
[]>stella: Dead. On the 18th.
text_data.1747993490.440--9223372036854774673:
[]>pedro: I don't know.
[]>pedro: Work hasn't let up, obviously.
[]>pedro: They wouldn't even give me one day of bereavement.
[]>pedro: And now I'm already drowning in tasks again.
[]>pedro: I don't even have time to grieve.
[]>stella: We're both fucked.
[]>stella: I've done nothing but.
[]>stella: I just wish I could focus my mind on literally anything else.
[]>pedro: Mhm.
[]>stella: I'm just numb.
text_data.1748000177.008--9223372036854774417:
[]>rose: I'm so glad we get to hang out again!
[]>rose: Thanks for reaching out.
[]>stella: Yeah, likewise.
[]>rose: How've you been? I got so swamped with my doctorate that I lost track of your circles a little.
[]>stella: Yeah...
[]>stella: Ah, fuck me.
[]>rose: What is it?
[]>rose: You said you had some news for me.
text_data.1748002103.086--9223372036854773520:
[]>stella: [wave amp=7.0 freq=2.0 connected=1]Fuuucking hell.[/wave] 
[]>stella: What was up with you?
[]>stella: Were you just struggling to find someone you'd consider close enough to put into your will?
[]>stella: Why's there Pedro and me and like one other person on the other side of the country and twice as many Discord handles?
[]>stella: I thought you...
[]>stella: [shake rate=20.0 level=2 connected=1]I thought you were...[/shake]
[]>stella: No fuck that noise!
[]>stella: [shake rate=20.0 level=2 connected=1]I know for a fact so many more people loved you.[/shake]
[]>stella: Yeah, fuck your family but why were there so few of your friends...
[]>stella: I hope that's just you being a silly child of the internet.
[]>stella: Tearing up again.
[]>stella: Great.
[]>stella:...
[]>stella: Fuck.
text_data.1748002636.566--9223372036854773389:
[]>stella: I don't think we'd have met without her.
[]>stella: And the same goes for like... half the people I know now.
[]>rose: ...
[]>stella: Can I give you a tissue?
[]>rose: It's... fine.
[]>rose: I have some on me.
[]>rose: Let's sit down somewhere.
text_data.amber-is-happy: []>amber{amber-emotion|happy}: I'm really happy to hear that! <mp>I think you're cool too!
